Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 2nd overall pick, by Houston in 2015...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/2/2015, off Brant Rustich (NYM)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/9/2015, off Brett Anderson (OAK)...
Traded from Houston to Los Angeles (A) on 2/2/2016 (Going to HOU: CF Mike Trout. Going to LAA: 2B Joe Wendle, 1B Lewin Diaz, 2B Jose Altuve)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/12/2016, hitting .538 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Baltimore on 7/23/2016...
Was selected to the 2017 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/11/2017 with a Strained Medial Collateral Ligament, out for 4 weeks...
2/2/2019: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,800,000 through salary arbitration...
1/31/2020: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,800,000 through salary arbitration...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Oakland on 4/15/2020...
Was selected to the 2020 Allstar game...
1/31/2021: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,800,000 through salary arbitration...

Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/2/2022 to a 3-year deal worth $21,000,000 per year...
Injured on 4/28/2022 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 5/16/2022...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Los Angeles (A) on 8/23/2022...

Was selected to the 2023 Allstar game...

10/26/2026: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles (A), $18,500,000 per year, for 3 years.
